fullText: The Great Gatsby Broadway Reviews @media only screen and (max-width: 768px) { .hide-on-mobile { display: none; } } Tickets Show Info Audience Reviews The party's roaring on Broadway! THE GREAT GATSBY is a “great, big Broadway extravaganza that explodes with life and energy” (Entertainment Weekly). Directed by Marc ... ( more info ). See what all the critics had to say and see all the ratings for The Great Gatsby including the New York Times and more... Theatre: Broadway Theatre (Broadway), 1681 Broadway POPULAR 1 OH, MARY! to Launch U.S. Tour in Fall 2026 2 Video: Watch the Next On Stage: Season 6 Finale 3 SINATRA THE MUSICAL Will Open in London's West End This Summer 4 Mark Consuelos, Christopher Fitzgerald, and More Join FALLEN ANGELS googletag.cmd.push(function(){googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1442371043694-2');}); { "@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Product", "name": "The Great Gatsby", "description": "The party's roaring on Broadway! THE GREAT GATSBY is a “great, big Broadway extravaganza that explodes with life and energy” (Entertainment Weekly). Directed by Marc Bruni (Beautiful: The Carole King Musical), this story of extravagance and longing features choreography by Dominique Kelley (So You Think You Can Dance), a book by Kait Kerrigan (The Mad Ones) and a jazz- and pop-influenced original score by Jason Howland (Little Women) and Nathan Tysen (Paradise Square).", "aggregateRating": { "@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "5", "worstRating": "0", "bestRating": "10", "ratingCount": "17" }, "review": [ { "@type": "Review", "author": { "@type": "Person", "name": "Laura Collins-Hughes" }, "datePublished": "2024-04-25", "name": "Review: A New ‘Great Gatsby’ Leads With Comedy and Romance", "reviewBody": "The darker elements of “The Great Gatsby” prove more elusive, which blunts the impact overall. So does the show’s anodyne Broadway sound, which is poppy and pleasant without being memorable. It summons neither the Jazz Age, like the soundtrack to Jack Clayton’s 1974 movie adaptation did, nor a spirit of wild abandon, like the soundtrack to Baz Luhrmann’s 2013 take. The score to this “Great Gatsby” is missing a vital urgency.", "reviewRating": { "@type": "Rating", "bestRating": "10", "worstRating": "0", "ratingValue": "5" } } , { "@type": "Review", "author": { "@type": "Person", "name": "Dan Rubins" }, "datePublished": "2024-04-25", "name": "The Great Gatsby Review: A Musical Take on a Classic Gets a Miraculous Broadway Makeover", "reviewBody": "And while any adaptation of The Great Gatsby has to thread the needle between wowing audiences with opulence and inviting critique of the ostentatious hollow center (those pyrotechnics are surely ironic, right?), the show’s final images seem to find that balance successfully. “I don’t want to live here, but I never want to leave,” the bombastically independent Jordan Baker (Samantha Pauly) sings as she enters one of Gatsby’s extravagant parties. That’s about right: If The Great Gatsby doesn’t have the makings of a long-term Broadway resident, it’s become, in its newly minted tension and decadence, a welcome visitor. ", "reviewRating": { "@type": "Rating", "bestRating": "10", "worstRating": "0", "ratingValue": "6" } } , { "@type": "Review", "author": { "@type": "Person", "name": "Christian Lewis" }, "datePublished": "2024-04-25", "name": "‘The Great Gatsby’ Review: Broadway Musical Has Glamour but Little Grit", "reviewBody": "For any fan of “The Great Gatsby,” though, it’s likely you’ll have moments of wanting more, of missing out on all the subtext, grit, and suffering beneath the sequins. Right as you have that pang, you’ll probably get distracted by another sweeping set change or production number, and as the opening and closing song playfully depict, the party will just keep rolling on and on and on, so you might as well join in and enjoy the ride. ", "reviewRating": { "@type": "Rating", "bestRating": "10", "worstRating": "0", "ratingValue": "6" } } , { "@type": "Review", "author": { "@type": "Person", "name": "Kobi Kassal" }, "datePublished": "2024-04-25", "name": "Big Ol’ Fashioned Broadway Fun At THE GREAT GATSBY — Review", "reviewBody": "Marc Bruni directs this entertaining, if uneven at parts, production with ease and style reminiscent of his stunning work on Beautiful: The Carole King Musical. With fierce, high octane choreography by Dominique Kelley on top of Paul Tate DePoo III’s stunning scenic and projection design (ay my performance the back LED wall did fade to black quite a few times accidentally), pleasant costume design by Linda Cho, and on the money lighting design by Cory Pattak, the world of Gatsby comes alive. ", "reviewRating": { "@type": "Rating", "bestRating": "10", "worstRating": "0", "ratingValue": "7" } } , { "@type": "Review", "author": { "@type": "Person", "name": "Sara Holdren" }, "datePublished": "2024-04-25", "name": "Can You Teach an Old Sport New Tricks? The Great Gatsby on Broadway", "reviewBody": "Under Marc Bruni...
showScoreExcerpt: "For a light, frothy evening out, this immersive show is your ticket, but don’t expect anything to last longer than the bubbles in the champagne they’re selling. Try reading the book."

keyPhrases.quote: So does the show's anodyne Broadway sound, which is poppy and pleasant without being memorable
If The Great Gatsby doesn't have the makings of a long-term Broadway resident, it's become, in its newly minted tension and decadence, a welcome visitor
you might as well join in and enjoy the ride

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Multiple critics offer qualified praise for the spectacle and production values while consistently noting significant flaws in the score and depth, suggesting a visually impressive but ultimately hollow experience worth seeing for the Broadway spectacle. | GPT-4o-mini: The reviews indicate a mix of enjoyment and disappointment, particularly regarding the music and depth of the adaptation, leading to a qualified recommendation.
